Context: The George Brown College-BOLT partnership is celebrating its 10th anniversary. BOLT, a Charitable Foundation established in 2013 by Leo & Sandra DelZotto, has been supporting students at George Brown College since the 2011-12 academic year through scholarships. In the 2022-2023 academic year, BOLT will provide a $21,000 annual gift to support seven deserving students in the Centre for Construction and Engineering Technologies (CCET) at the college. Throughout the partnership, BOLT has provided over 280 scholarships to students and co-hosts the "Day of Discovery" event with CCET. The BOLT Foundation is supported by Tridel, Canada's largest condo developer and its Principal & Founding Sponsor. Raly Chakarova serves as the Executive Director of the BOLT Foundation. The support from BOLT for George Brown College students is under the guidance of Leo DelZotto. Dr. Cindy Gouveia is the Vice President, Office of Advancement, and President of the George Brown College Foundation, while Dr. Gervan Fearon is the George Brown College President.

Context: George Brown College has had a partnership with BOLT for ten years. Dr. Gervan Fearon is the President of George Brown College. The college offers opportunities for students to pursue careers in construction and engineering fields through this partnership with BOLT. There are application deadlines, college news, upcoming events, tours, and other information that can be signed up for on the college website. The contact details for the college are: 416-415-2000, TTY: 1-877-515-5559, ask.george@georgebrown.ca. The college has a social media hub. The information on the website is subject to change without notice and should not be considered as a representation, offer or warranty. Students are responsible for verifying George Brown College fee requirements.
